keyFacts: John D. Loez was a Criminal Investigator (Special Agent) for the IRS Criminal Investigation Division from April 1988 to May 2013.
He initiated and managed the New York Asset Forfeiture Task Force (NYAFTF), which resulted in over 150 convictions and asset seizures exceeding $350 million.
His post-IRS consulting work included confidential investigations for firms like Kostelanetz & Fink LLP, Baker Tilly, and Thacher Associates, as well as anti-money laundering compliance for banks.
He provided investigative support to numerous federal agencies including the DEA, FBI, ICE, USSS, and various U.S. Attorney's Offices.
The document is a professional resume/CV and does not contain any direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his crimes.
